title: add the option to provide templates for newly created files
body:
this gives apps the option to define a template for newly created files based on the mimetype, for example newly created html files automatically get filled with [basic html boilerplate](https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/1c1ede57034343830696667820115435db5509ba/core/templates/filetemplates/template.html).

apps can currently define templates the following way:
`oc_helper::getfiletemplatemanager()->registertemplate('foo/bar', 'path/to/template.txt')`

other options for templates can be xml files, [markdown files](https://github.com/icewind1991/owncloud-markdown), [reveal.js files](https://github.com/icewind1991/reveal) or any other filetype where having a basic boilerplate helps.

additionally this code splits of the mimetype detection code from oc_helper to cleanup that class a bit, a side effect from this is that apps can now define their own extension -> mimetype mappings which removes the need to patch core when creating an app that handles a custom mimetype.

apps can register a mimetype for files ending with `.bar` by doing
`oc_helper::getmimetypedetector()->registertype('bar', 'foo/bar')`

testing can be done by creating a new html file and opening it in the editor
